elements.content: Via hydrothermal synthesis, the self-assembly of M(II) ions, H3BTC or H2NDC with three structure-related flexible bis(imidazole) ligands, L1, L2, and L3, generated six metal−organic polymers (M = Co, Ni, Zn; BTC = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylate, NDC = 1,2-benzenebicarboxylate, L1 = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene, L2 = 1,1′-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole), L3 = 1,1′-(1,4-hexanediyl)bis (imidazole)): {Co3(L1)3(BTC)2(μ-H2O)3·2H2O} n (1), {Zn2(L2)(HBTC)2·2H2O} n (2), {Co(L3)(HBTC)} n (3), {Co(L1) (NDC)} n (4), {Ni(L2)(NDC)} n (5), and {Co(L3) (NDC)} n (6). The structure of 1 is the rare 4-connected self-penetrating metal−organic framework (MOF) with the (63)2(64·82)2(62·84) topology notation; polymers 2 and 6 are two-dimensional (2D) (3,4)-connected and 4-connected nets, respectively. If the O−H…O/2.631 Å hydrogen bonds between HBTC2− dianions are not accounted for, then polymer 3 is a 2D (3,5)-connected net; contrarily, it is a pillar-layered three-dimensional supramolecular framework characterized by (4,5)-connected (42·62·82)(42·68) topology. 4 and 5 show 4-connected MOFs with 65·10 and 65·8 CdSO4-type topology, respectively. Furthermore, their thermal properties are studied by thermogravimetric analysis.

The structure of 1 is the rare 4-connected self-penetrating metal-organic framework (MOF) with the (63)2(64⋅82)2(62⋅84) topology notation; polymers 2 and 6 are two-dimensional (2D) (3,4)-connected and 4-connected nets, respectively. If the O-H…O/2.631 Å hydrogen bonds between HBTC2- dianions are not accounted for, then polymer 3 is a 2D (3,5)-connected net; contrarily, it is a pillar-layered three-dimensional supramolecular framework characterized by (4,5)-connected (42⋅62⋅82)(42⋅68) topology. 4 and 5 show 4-connected MOFs with 65⋅10 and 65⋅8 CdSO4-type topology, respectively. Furthermore, their thermal properties are studied by thermogravimetric analysis.

elements.content: The self-assembly of M(II), bis(imidazole) ligands, L1, L2, L3, and H3BTC, or H2NDC generated six novel metal−organic frameworks (MOFs) with elegant topological structures, viz., the first (3,4)-connected self-penetrating frameworks, the first coordinating bonds and H-bonds constructing (4,5)-connected frameworks, the first 4-connected 65·10 frameworks, and rare 65·8 CdSO4-type frameworks.
elements.clean_text: The self-assembly of M(II), bis(imidazole) ligands, L1, L2, L3, and H3BTC, or H2NDC generated six novel metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) with elegant topological structures, viz., the first (3,4)-connected self-penetrating frameworks, the first coordinating bonds and H-bonds constructing (4,5)-connected frameworks, the first 4-connected 65⋅10 frameworks, and rare 65⋅8 CdSO4-type frameworks.

elements.content: Crystal engineering based on metal−organic frameworks (MOFs) has recently attracted considerable interest, owing to their elegant framework topologies as well as their potential applications in molecular magnetism, catalysis, gas sorption, fluorescent sensing, and optoelectronic devices. Studies in this field have been focused on the design and preparation, as well as the structure–property relationships. Although big progress has been achieved, it is still a great challenge to predict the exact structures and composition of the assembly products built by coordination bonds and/or hydrogen bonds in crystal engineering. As we know, there are several factors, such as the coordination nature of ligand structure, counterions, and so on, which may be key for the rational design of MOFs. Therefore, systematic research on this topic is still important for understanding the roles of these factors in the formation of metal−organic coordination frameworks.
elements.clean_text:
Introduction

Crystal engineering based on metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) has recently attracted considerable interest, owing to their elegant framework topologies as well as their potential applications in molecular magnetism, catalysis, gas sorption, fluorescent sensing, and optoelectronic devices. Studies in this field have been focused on the design and preparation, as well as the structure-property relationships. Although big progress has been achieved, it is still a great challenge to predict the exact structures and composition of the assembly products built by coordination bonds and/or hydrogen bonds in crystal engineering. As we know, there are several factors, such as the coordination nature of ligand structure, counterions, and so on, which may be key for the rational design of MOFs. Therefore, systematic research on this topic is still important for understanding the roles of these factors in the formation of metal-organic coordination frameworks.

elements.content: Lately, a large number of MOFs based on flexible bis(imidazole) ligands have been constructed. Such ligands bearing alkyl spacers are a good choice of a N-donor ligand, and to hold the energetic minimum, the flexible nature of spacers allows the ligands to bend and rotate when it coordinates to metal centers, and this often causes the structural diversity. Upon careful inspection of the reported cases, we found that most of them are focused on the metal−bis(imidazole)−inorganic counterion (such as Cl−, ClO4 −, SO4 2−, NO3 −) system; by contrast, the exploration of metal−bis(imidazole)−organic counterion (such as BTC3−, NDC2−) system is less developed. Hence, in light of this, a series of the metal−bis(imidazole)−organic counterion compounds are prepared by the self-assembly of M(II) ions, flexible bis(imidazole) ligands (L1, L2, and L3), and H3BTC or H2NDC.
elements.clean_text: Lately, a large number of MOFs based on flexible bis(imidazole) ligands have been constructed. Such ligands bearing alkyl spacers are a good choice of a N-donor ligand, and to hold the energetic minimum, the flexible nature of spacers allows the ligands to bend and rotate when it coordinates to metal centers, and this often causes the structural diversity. Upon careful inspection of the reported cases, we found that most of them are focused on the metal-bis(imidazole)-inorganic counterion (such as Cl-, ClO4 -, SO4 2-, NO3 -) system; by contrast, the exploration of metal-bis(imidazole)-organic counterion (such as BTC3-, NDC2-) system is less developed. Hence, in light of this, a series of the metal-bis(imidazole)-organic counterion compounds are prepared by the self-assembly of M(II) ions, flexible bis(imidazole) ligands (L1, L2, and L3), and H3BTC or H2NDC.

elements.content: Commercially available reagents were used as received without further purification. The ligands L1, L2, and L3 were prepared according to reported procedures. Elemental analysis (EA) for C, H, and N was performed on a Perkin-Elmer 240 analyzer. Thermogravimetric analyses were performed with a Shimadzu TGA-50H TG analyzer in the range of 30–800 °C under a nitrogen flow at a heating rate of 5 °C/min for all measurements.
elements.clean_text:
Experimental Section

Materials and Physical Measurements

Commercially available reagents were used as received without further purification. The ligands L1, L2, and L3 were prepared according to reported procedures. Elemental analysis (EA) for C, H, and N was performed on a Perkin-Elmer 240 analyzer. Thermogravimetric analyses were performed with a Shimadzu TGA-50H TG analyzer in the range of 30-800 °C under a nitrogen flow at a heating rate of 5 °C/min for all measurements.

elements.content: A mixture of CoCl2·6H2O (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), H3BTC (0.21 g, 1.0 mmol), and L1 (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol) was placed in a Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, and then the pH was adjusted to 6.0 by addition of dilute NaOH solution (1.0 mol/L). The mixture was sealed and heated at 150 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Purple crystals were obtained in yield (based on Co): 52%. Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. for (C120H116Co6N24O34): C 51.62, H 4.19, N 12.04. Found: C 51.71, H 4.16, N 11.95.

elements.content: Suitable single crystals of 1–6 were selected and mounted in air onto thin glass fibers. Accurate unit cell parameters were determined by a least-squares fit of 2θ values, and intensity data were measured on a Rigaku R-AXIS RAPID IP area diffractometer with Mo Kα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å) at room temperature. The intensities were corrected for Lorentz and polarization effects as well as for empirical absorption based on multiscan technique; all structures were solved by direct methods and refined by full-matrix least-squares fitting on F 2 by SHELX-97. All non-hydrogen atoms were refined with anisotropic thermal parameters. Crystallographic data for the three compounds are summarized in Table .
elements.clean_text:
X-ray Structural Studies

Suitable single crystals of 1-6 were selected and mounted in air onto thin glass fibers. Accurate unit cell parameters were determined by a least-squares fit of 2θ values, and intensity data were measured on a Rigaku R-AXIS RAPID IP area diffractometer with Mo Kα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å) at room temperature. The intensities were corrected for Lorentz and polarization effects as well as for empirical absorption based on multiscan technique; all structures were solved by direct methods and refined by full-matrix least-squares fitting on F 2 by SHELX-97. All non-hydrogen atoms were refined with anisotropic thermal parameters. Crystallographic data for the three compounds are summarized in Table .

elements.clean_text:
Results and Discussion

Synthesis

In this system, the formation of them is sensitive to the pH value of solution. For all of them, if pH value was >6 or <5, then no product was obtained. The reported pH value in the experimental section is the best choice, based on the yield.

Description of Crystal Structures

The ligands involved in this research and the coordination mode of the poly-carboxylate ligands are listed in Schemes  and . In 1, the guest water molecule is distorted, and its amount was confirmed by TG and EA analysis.

elements.content:
<fig fig-type="scheme" id="sch1" orientation="portrait" position="float">
<label>1</label>
<graphic id="gs1" orientation="portrait" position="anchor" xlink:href="cg-2007-00758c_0002.tif"></graphic>
</fig>

In the asymmetry unit, there are two independent cobalt atoms: Co1 is coordinated by two BTC3− oxygen atoms and two L1 nitrogen atoms to give the CoO2N2 tetrahedral geometry, whereas Co2 located on an inversion center shows the CoO4N2 octahedral geometry completed by two BTC3− oxygen atoms, two L1 nitrogen atoms, and two terminal water molecules. The Co−O/N bond lengths are in the range of 2.008–2.157 Å, comparable with that observed in other Co-based complexes. The completely deprotonated BTC3− ligands display the tri(monodentate) coordinated mode (I), as illustrated in Scheme , while the bis(imidazole) ligand of L1 affords the anti−anti coordinated fashion.

elements.content: Further, the Co(II) ions are in turn connected by BTC3− and L1 to give rise to the complicated three-dimensional (3D) frameworks with the small solvent-accessible void space occupied by free water molecules (139 Å3, equal to 4.7% of the cell volume), which are stabilized by O−H…O hydrogen bonds between host frameworks and guest water molecules. Better insight into such elegant frameworks can be accessed by the topology method: first, based on the considerations of the their connectivity, Co1, Co2, and BTC3− are viewed to be four-, four-, and three-connected nodes; second, Co−O/N coordination bonds and L1 ligands are simplified to be linear connectors; then the combination of nodes and connectors suggests the (3,4)-connected frameworks for the present case. The topological notation for such (3,4)-connected frameworks is (63)2(64·82)2(62·84). In the literature, the (3,4)-connected frameworks are often encountered, but we are not aware of a precedent characterized by such topology like that found in 1.

elements.content: Careful inspection of such frameworks suggests self-penetration for them. As shown in Figure , the catenated 8-rings are the shortest rings. On the basis of a query on the Scifinder (2006) program with self-penetration or self-penetrating topical research and several reviewers in this field, we find that there are at most 30 3D polymers with such self-penetrating motifs. Further analysis indicates that most of them are built on 4-, 5-, 6-, 8-, (3,5)-, or (3,6)-connected nodes; however, the (3,4)-connected self-penetrating 3D polymers are never explored. Hence, polymer 1 is the first (3,4)-connected self-penetrating 3D polymer with unprecedented (63)2(64·82)2(62·84) topology.

elements.content: If the O−H···O/2.630 Å hydrogen bonds between HBTC2− ligands are not accounted for, then this 2D net is also a binodal (3,5)-connected net with (42·6)(42·68) topological notation, constructed from the 3-connected HBTC2− and 5-connected center nodes; contrarily, as shown in Figure , the assembly of HBTC2− and cobalt ions via hydrogen bonds and Co−O coordination bonds gives the 2D sheet structure with (3,4)-connected topology, where Co(II) ions and HBTC2− act as 3-, and 4-connected nodes, respectively. Further, these (3,4)-connected sheets separated by ca. 0.8 nm are pillared by L3 via the Co−N connections to generate the pillar-layered 3D framework. From a topological view, such a special framework features (4,5)-connected (42·62·82)(42·68) topology; to our best knowledge, this is the first (4,5)-connected supramolecular MOF (Figure ).

elements.content: Compared with polymer 1, the H3BTC ligands are replaced by H2NDC, and the resulting structure is the 4-connected 65·10 frameworks. Polymer 4 crystallizes in the noncenter Cc space group. In 4, each cobalt ion is coordinated by two NDC2− oxygen atoms and two L1 nitrogen atoms to furnish the tetrahedral geometry. The Co−O/N bond lengths vary from 1.990 to 2.068 Å. The coordinate mode for NDC2− and L1 are monodentate, with the NDC2− ion possessing a coordination mode of type III, and the ligand in an anti−anti conformation.

Compared with polymer 1, the H3BTC ligands are replaced by H2NDC, and the resulting structure is the 4-connected 65⋅10 frameworks. Polymer 4 crystallizes in the noncenter Cc space group. In 4, each cobalt ion is coordinated by two NDC2- oxygen atoms and two L1 nitrogen atoms to furnish the tetrahedral geometry. The Co-O/N bond lengths vary from 1.990 to 2.068 Å. The coordinate mode for NDC2- and L1 are monodentate, with the NDC2- ion possessing a coordination mode of type III, and the ligand in an anti-anti conformation.

elements.content: The Ni(II) ions are bridged by NDC2− to give rise to the neutral one-dimensional (1D) chain, {Ni(NDC2−)} n , and such chains are further connected by L2 via Ni−N coordination bonds, thus leading to the formation of 3D frameworks. Better insight into the present 3D frameworks can be accessed by the topological method. Each Ni(II) ion connect to four other Ni(II) ions via two NDC2− and two L2 spacers; hence, it can be viewed to be 4-connected nodes. Such connectivity repeats infinitely to give the 3D 65·8 CdSO4-type frameworks (Figure ). In the field of 4-connected frameworks, the diamond nets are often encountered; by contrast, CdSO4, PtS, quartz, and sra nets are relatively rare.

Similar to polymer 5, along the c direction, the arrangement of Co(II) and NDC2− gives the 1D helical chain of {Co(NDC2−)} n (Figure ), and these chains are further connected together by L3 via Co−N coordination bonds to construct 2D undulated (4,4) nets (Figure ). In addition, no significant supramolecular interactions such as H-bonds and π−π interactions are observed between (4,4) layers.

elements.content: From their structure, we find that, in the M-bis(imidazole)-H3BTC system, the dimension of the final MOFs is determined by H3BTC lignads rather than the bis(imidazole) ligands: in polymer 1, the H3BTC molecules are completely deprotonated, thus leading to the 3D (3,4)-connected net, while in polymer 2 and 3, the H3BTC molecules are partly deprotonated and result in the 2D (3,4)-, or (3,5)-connected net; on the other hand, in the M-bis(imidazole)-H2NDC system, the dimension of the final MOFs is determined by bis(imidazole) ligands rather than by H2NDC: in polymers 4, 5, and 6, H2NDC ligands are completely deprotonated and hold the bidentate coordination mode, but result in 3D or 2D nets, due to the effect of the flexible diversity of the bis(imidazole) ligands. From the analysis of their topological matrix, we also find that the H3BTC ligands are a good candidate to construct (3,n)-connected nets, where n is determined by other nodes.

From the analysis of their topological matrix, we also find that the H3BTC ligands are a good candidate to construct (3,n)-connected nets, where n is determined by other nodes.

elements.content: The experiments were performed on crystal samples of each compound under N2 atmosphere at a heating rate of 5 °C/min without pretreatment before the TG measurement. Polymer 1 lost the free and coordinated water molecules at 60–160 °C (calc. 6.4%, exp. 6.2%), while 2 released the free water molecules at 150–200 °C (calc. 4.6%, exp. 4.2%); these results are seemingly unbelievable. Hence, we tried the measurements again upon the crystal samples, but we got the same outcome. On the basis of their structure, in 1, the intercalated distorted free water molecules form strong H-bonds with coordinated water molecules, and the Co−Owater bonds are obviously longer than the Co−Ocarboxylate/NL1 bonds, indicating the not-so-strong Co−Owaterinteractions; thus, the unusual weight loss is possible. The free water molecules in 2 form three strong H-bonds with HBTC2− to construct the 3D frameworks; so, in some sense, the weight loss of free water molecules at 150–200 °C is possible. The frameworks of these polymers can be stable up to about 360 °C for 1, 2, 3 and 300 °C for 4, 5, 6; this indicates that the H3BTC-based frameworks have more thermal stability than H2NTC-based frameworks (Figure ).
elements.clean_text:
Thermogravimetric (TG) Experiments

The experiments were performed on crystal samples of each compound under N2 atmosphere at a heating rate of 5 °C/min without pretreatment before the TG measurement. Polymer 1 lost the free and coordinated water molecules at 60-160 °C (calc. 6.4%, exp. 6.2%), while 2 released the free water molecules at 150-200 °C (calc. 4.6%, exp. 4.2%); these results are seemingly unbelievable. Hence, we tried the measurements again upon the crystal samples, but we got the same outcome. On the basis of their structure, in 1, the intercalated distorted free water molecules form strong H-bonds with coordinated water molecules, and the Co-Owater bonds are obviously longer than the Co-Ocarboxylate/NL1 bonds, indicating the not-so-strong Co-Owaterinteractions; thus, the unusual weight loss is possible. The free water molecules in 2 form three strong H-bonds with HBTC2- to construct the 3D frameworks; so, in some sense, the weight loss of free water molecules at 150-200 °C is possible. The frameworks of these polymers can be stable up to about 360 °C for 1, 2, 3 and 300 °C for 4, 5, 6; this indicates that the H3BTC-based frameworks have more thermal stability than H2NTC-based frameworks (Figure ).

elements.content: In this work, we have systemically studied the system of M(II)−bis(imidazole)−organic counterion by choosing L1, L2, L3 as bis(imidazole) ligands, and H3BTC(H2NDC) as organic counterions. These resulting polymers 1–6 hold the 2D or 3D framework structure, viz., the first (3,4)-connected self-penetrating frameworks of 1, the (3,4)-connected 2D nets of 2, the first coordinating bonds and H-bonds constructing (4,5)-connected frameworks of 3, the first 4-connected 65·10 frameworks of 4, the rare 65·8 CdSO4-type frameworks of 5, and the undulated 2D (4,4) frameworks of 6. To some extent, this work will largely enrich the field of MOFs.
elements.clean_text:
Conclusion

In this work, we have systemically studied the system of M(II)-bis(imidazole)-organic counterion by choosing L1, L2, L3 as bis(imidazole) ligands, and H3BTC(H2NDC) as organic counterions. These resulting polymers 1-6 hold the 2D or 3D framework structure, viz., the first (3,4)-connected self-penetrating frameworks of 1, the (3,4)-connected 2D nets of 2, the first coordinating bonds and H-bonds constructing (4,5)-connected frameworks of 3, the first 4-connected 65⋅10 frameworks of 4, the rare 65⋅8 CdSO4-type frameworks of 5, and the undulated 2D (4,4) frameworks of 6. To some extent, this work will largely enrich the field of MOFs.

cln_elements.content:
A mixture of CoCl2·6H2O (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), H3BTC (0.21 g, 1.0 mmol), and L1 (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol) was placed in a Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, and then the pH was adjusted to 6.0 by addition of dilute NaOH solution (1.0 mol/L). The mixture was sealed and heated at 150 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Purple crystals were obtained in yield (based on Co): 52%. Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. for (C120H116Co6N24O34): C 51.62, H 4.19, N 12.04. Found: C 51.71, H 4.16, N 11.95.

Synthesis of <bold>2</bold>

A mixture of Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (0.30 g, 1.0 mmol), H3BTC (0.21 g, 1.0 mmol), and L2 (0.19 g, 1.0 mmol) was placed in a Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, and then the pH was adjusted to 5.5 by addition of dilute NaOH solution (1.0 mol/L). The mixture was sealed and heated at 160 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Colorless crystals of 2 were obtained in yield (based on Zn): 58%. Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. for (C14H13N2O7Zn): C 43.49, H 3.39, N 7.24. Found: C 43.55, H 3.31, N 7.29.

Synthesis of <bold>3</bold>

A mixture of CoCl2·6H2O (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), H3BTC (0.21 g, 1.0 mmol), and L3 (0.22 g, 1.0 mmol) was placed in a Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, and then the pH was adjusted to 5.0 by addition of dilute NaOH solution (1.0 mol/L). The mixture was sealed and heated at 150 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Purple crystals of 3 were obtained in yield (based on Co): 43%. Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. for (C21H22CoN4O6): C 51.97, H 4.57, N 11.54. Found: C 51.90, H 4.63, N 11.59.

Synthesis of <bold>4</bold>

The reaction conditions are similar as described in 1 except that equal H2NDC was used instead of H3BTC. Purple crystals of 4 were obtained in yield (based on Co): 41%. Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. for (C22H18CoN4O4): C 57.28, H 3.93, N 12.14. Found: C 57.19, H 3.98, N 12.21.

Synthesis of <bold>5</bold>

The reaction conditions are similar as described in 2 except that equal H2NDC and NiCl2 were used instead of H3BTC and Zn(NO3)2. Green crystals of 5 were obtained in yield (based on Ni): 56%. Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. for (C36H36N8Ni2O8): C 52.34, H 4.39, N 13.56. Found: C 52.28, H 4.45, N 13.62.

Synthesis of <bold>6</bold>

The reaction conditions are similar as described in 3 except that equal H2NDC was used instead of H3BTC. Purple crystals of 6 were obtained in yield (based on Ni): 51%. Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. for (C20H22CoN4O4): C 54.43, H 5.02, N 12.69. Found: C 54.50, H 5.10, N 12.64.

Synthesis of 1 

A mixture of CoCl2⋅6H2O (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), H3BTC (0.21 g, 1.0 mmol), and L1 (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol) was placed in a Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, and then the pH was adjusted to 6.0 by addition of dilute NaOH solution (1.0 mol/L). The mixture was sealed and heated at 150 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Purple crystals were obtained in yield (based on Co): 52%. Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. for (C120H116Co6N24O34): C 51.62, H 4.19, N 12.04. Found: C 51.71, H 4.16, N 11.95.

The mixture was sealed and heated at 160 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Colorless crystals of 2 were obtained in yield (based on Zn): 58%. cln_elements.content: The experiments were performed on crystal samples of each compound under N2 atmosphere at a heating rate of 5 °C/min without pretreatment before the TG measurement. Polymer 1 lost the free and coordinated water molecules at 60–160 °C (calc. 6.4%, exp. 6.2%), while 2 released the free water molecules at 150–200 °C (calc. 4.6%, exp. 4.2%); these results are seemingly unbelievable. Hence, we tried the measurements again upon the crystal samples, but we got the same outcome. On the basis of their structure, in 1, the intercalated distorted free water molecules form strong H-bonds with coordinated water molecules, and the Co−Owater bonds are obviously longer than the Co−Ocarboxylate/NL1 bonds, indicating the not-so-strong Co−Owaterinteractions; thus, the unusual weight loss is possible. The free water molecules in 2 form three strong H-bonds with HBTC2− to construct the 3D frameworks; so, in some sense, the weight loss of free water molecules at 150–200 °C is possible. The frameworks of these polymers can be stable up to about 360 °C for 1, 2, 3 and 300 °C for 4, 5, 6; this indicates that the H3BTC-based frameworks have more thermal stability than H2NTC-based frameworks (Figure ).
cln_elements.clean_text:
Thermogravimetric (TG) Experiments

The experiments were performed on crystal samples of each compound under N2 atmosphere at a heating rate of 5 °C/min without pretreatment before the TG measurement. Polymer 1 lost the free and coordinated water molecules at 60-160 °C (calc. 6.4%, exp. 6.2%), while 2 released the free water molecules at 150-200 °C (calc. 4.6%, exp. 4.2%); these results are seemingly unbelievable. Hence, we tried the measurements again upon the crystal samples, but we got the same outcome. On the basis of their structure, in 1, the intercalated distorted free water molecules form strong H-bonds with coordinated water molecules, and the Co-Owater bonds are obviously longer than the Co-Ocarboxylate/NL1 bonds, indicating the not-so-strong Co-Owaterinteractions; thus, the unusual weight loss is possible. The free water molecules in 2 form three strong H-bonds with HBTC2- to construct the 3D frameworks; so, in some sense, the weight loss of free water molecules at 150-200 °C is possible. The frameworks of these polymers can be stable up to about 360 °C for 1, 2, 3 and 300 °C for 4, 5, 6; this indicates that the H3BTC-based frameworks have more thermal stability than H2NTC-based frameworks (Figure ).
